result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keeman A Raymar

records.addlTxt: Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keeman A. Raymar in court without counsel.  Case recalled at 10:20 a.m.  Preliminary hearing was scheduled for earlier today.  Court cancels warrant and bail forfeiture and reinstates bond.  State moves to dismiss without prejudice and Court so orders.  (Warrant previously issued but not processed - no order to cancel warrant necessary)
Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by defendant.  Case called at 9:45 a.m.  State requests a warrant.  Court issues a warrant and orders bail forfeiture.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keeman A. Raymar in court without counsel.  Defendant has missed appointments with SPD and wishes to represent himself.  Defendant waives right to attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keeman A. Raymar in court without counsel.  Defendant states he missed his appointment with DA.  Adjourned to allow pretrial with DA and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keeman A Raymar in court.  Defendant moves to dismiss the case.  Court will not address the motion to dismiss at this time and has colloquy w/ defendant regarding right to representation and intent to obtain counsel.  Defendant states will be representing himself and waives right to an attorney, Court questions defendant and accepts waiver.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and directs defendant to meet w/ DA prior to the adjourned hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any Walmart stores in Washington County, co-defendants A.S. or A.W. Not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keeman A Raymar appeared by video, in custody. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant indicates that he is not the person associated with the complaint, he never received notice of the hearing. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Defendant will be retaining counsel and will be going to SPD to see if qualifies; Court sets $1500 sig bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position.
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keeman A Raymar
Current: 2314 N 41st St, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: 819 W Sierra Lane, Mequon, WI 53092
Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by defendant or anyone on his behalf.  Court issues warrant.
Initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
